result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 16CF4, 16CF5, 15CF156 & 15CF159, Defendant Daniel J Poteat  #556764 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2 in 15CF156 and count 4 in 16CF4. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. 15CF159, 16CF5 and remaining counts in 16CF4 read in and dismissed. Court PSI to be completed. Argued sentencing to be scheduled after PSI filed. Bonds continued.
Jury trial on November 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cases called: 16CF4 & 16CF5, Defendant Daniel J Poteat in court, in custody with Atty. Ron Benavides.  ADA Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Cases called: 16CF4 & 16CF5, Defendant Daniel J Poteat in court, in custody with Atty. Ron Benavides.  ADA Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
standard felony conditions, no contact w/D.F., J.F., and E.M.

Defendant Daniel J Poteat in court, in custody by video with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E.
